title: When forwarding links, some are corrupted...
content:
When I forward some links, rather than taking the recipient to the specific YouTube page, the link takes them to the YouTube home page. Other sites I can still forward correctly. I have researched this issue and except for a virus that affected Firefox a few years back, I have found nothing. I have run spyware, malware, and virusware with no change.

Is this a YouTube issue? Another form of Big Tech censorship? Anyone else out there having issues like this?

I finally put FireFox in the garbage can in my iMac (Big Sur 11.5.1) and flushed it and then downloaded a new copy. No difference. I deleted all my cookies per the Firefox suggested repair page. Why would a specific site generate these forward issues? Just for giggles, I tried a forward in Safari (which I never otherwise use) and the links work correctly.

I have been a Firefox supporter from the very beginning and hate to swap browsers. Thank you to all the wonderful code writers and tech support volunteers out there who make this effort possible.
creator: a737

title: Nothing synced
content: I signed up/logged in to firefox before I reset my PC, to save all my bookmarks and passwords, only for me to finally get my PC back up and running with NOTHING synced. How do I fix this there is 0 chance I get back my old install as I have formatted.

Přeji pěkný den

creator: wentz1

title: Print webpage enlarges 4x
content:
• When I try to print a webpage using Firefox, the page enlarges 4x and therefore I only get 1/4 of the webpage on an 8.5 x 11 sheet. If I change my browser to Chrome or IE, it prints correctly. If I scroll to the bottom of the Firefox Print Dialog window and select "Print using system dialog" it also works correctly.
  • I have the zoom set to 100 and the Print Dialog paper size set to Letter, It is set to print to page width, I tried it with Scale 100 but it didn't help. I also went to about: config and checked that the paper size and scaling were set to 1.
  • The the picture of the Print Preview looks exactly like should be when printed, but when it is sent to the Lexmark S505 printer the size is too large. 
Since I print 50-100 individual webpages a week, I cannot use Firefox if this can't be corrected.

Thanks, Randall Win7 Pro
creator: zzzrsc

title: Firefox keeps auto generating "new bookmarks" and "new folders"
content:
Firefox keeps auto generating "new bookmarks" and "new folders". It is generating these faster than I can delete them. It is maddening!

I like Firefox but I need to control this mess or move on.

Thanks
creator: rlsomrak

title: Sometimes firefox does not recognize links as "links"?
content:
Hey.

I don't know if it's a "problem" or it's really right.

What you need to do for see an example of what I'm saying: 1. Open Telegram Web (web.telegram.org/k/) 2. Right click on any link 3. Right click again, over the link

You'll see a normal options menu, FF is not recognizing as a link So, because of that we can't open links using private window

I don't think anyone has noticed that yet.
creator: saynotozucker

title: microphone for forefox
content:
I have a Chromebook HP 360 running Linux Today I used Linux and managed to get Firefox to work on my Chromebook it works fantastic except for one issue

I can't seem to get a microphone that will work with anything but Bing so if I asked Bing a question I can use the microphone

what I want to do is type in Facebook Messenger or write an email and use a microphone to do it the microphone on my Chromebook in my accessibility features will only work with my Chromebook it won't work with a Firefox browser is there an add-on somewhere that I can use that I can't find that will accomplish what I'm trying to do.

It's so much easier to tap the microphone button and then speak instead of type especially if I have a long letter to write.
creator: mdcc1022

title: finding way to sync two firefox browsers in 100%
